member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.Database.Configuration.DataCacheStorageData
member.summary: Configuration information for DataCacheStorageData. This class represents the extra information, over and above what is defined in , needed to connect caching to the Data Access Application Block.

member.overloads: Initializes an instance of a class.
member.summary: Initializes an instance of a class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.Database.Configuration.DataCacheStorageData.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class with a name, database instance name, and partion name.
member.param: The name of the provider.
Name of the database instance to use for storage. Instance must be defined in Data configuration.

Name of the particular section inside of a database used to store this provider's data. This field allows different applications to share the same database safely, preventing any modification of one application's data by a provider from another application.

member.summary: Name of the database instance to use for storage. Instance must be defined in Data configuration.

member.summary: Name of the particular section inside of a database used to store this provider's data. This field allows different applications to share the same database safely, preventing any modification of one application's data by a provider from another application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.Database.Configuration.Manageability.DataCacheStorageDataManageabilityProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class.
Adds the ADM instructions that describe the policies that can be used to override the properties of a specific instance of the configuration element type managed by the receiver.
member.param: The to which the Adm instructions are to be appended.
The configuration object instance.
The configuration source from where to get additional configuration information, if necessary.
The key for the element's policies.
member.remarks:
The default implementation for this method creates a policy, using to create the policy name and invoking
to add the policy parts. Subclasses managing objects that must not create a policy must override this method to just add the parts.

member.summary: Adds the ADM parts that represent the properties of a specific instance of the configuration element type managed by the receiver.
member.param: The to which the Adm instructions are to be appended.
The configuration object instance.
The configuration source from where to get additional configuration information, if necessary.
The key for the element's policies.
member.remarks: Subclasses managing objects that must not create a policy will likely need to include the elements' keys when creating the parts.

member.summary: Overrides the 's properties with the Group Policy values from the registry.
member.param: The configuration object for instances that must be managed.
The which holds the Group Policy overrides for the configuration element.
member.remarks: Subclasses implementing this method must retrieve all the override values from the registry before making modifications to the so any error retrieving the override values will cancel policy processing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.Database.DataBackingStore.Flush
member.summary: Flushes all CacheItems from database. If an exception is thrown during the flush, the database is left unchanged.
member.remarks: Exceptions thrown depend on the implementation of the underlying database.

member.summary: Loads data from persistence store.
member.returns: Unfiltered hashtable of cache items loaded from persistence store.
